intro: Hedyotis brunonis, commonly known as the purple marsh woundwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in moist, acidic soils. It is often found in coastal areas and can tolerate periodic flooding. Hedyotis brunonis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
